tool.name: bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
tool.description: Call copy number variation from VCF B-allele frequency (BAF) and Log R Ratio intensity (LRR) values

param.name: query_sample
param.label: Query Sample
param.help: The name (as used in the input) of the query sample in the input. Can be ommitted if, and only if, there is only one sample in the input.

param.name: control_sample
param.label: Control Sample
param.help: The name (as used in the input) of an optional control sample to compare against. Note: The pairwise calling mode represents the real strength of the tool as it helps to reduce the number of false calls and also allows one to distinguish between normal and novel copy number variation.

param.name: generate_plots
param.label: Plot results?
param.option: Yes, plot results for all chromosomes
Yes, but plot only chromosomes with above-threshold quality of CNV status estimate

param.name: plot_threshold
param.label: Plot Threshold
param.help: Plot aberrant chromosomes with quality at least 'float'

param.name: aberrant_query
param.label: Estimated purity of the query sample
param.help: Estimate of the fractional contribution of the desired query tissue to the (possibly control-contaminated) query sample (default: 1 = no contamination with control tissue)

param.name: aberrant_control
param.label: Estimated purity of the control sample
param.help: Estimate of the fractional contribution of the desired control tissue to the (possibly query-contaminated) control sample (default: 1 = no contamination with query tissue)

param.name: do_optimize
param.label: Adjust sample purity estimates based on data?
param.help: Instead of treating your specified estimates of the sample purities as fixed values, the tool can use them as starting values for an iterative optimization that tries to estimate the sample purities from the data. Note: With estimate optimization enabled the final estimates will be reported as cell fraction (CF) estimates in the summary report.
param.option: No, leave sample purities as specified

param.name: lower_bound
param.label: Lower bound for adjusted estimate
param.help: Constrains the final adjusted purity estimates not to be smaller than this value.

param.name: compute_on
param.label: Use BAF and LRR annotations to call CNVs?
param.help: Using LRR information in addition to BAF values is the default and helps in dealing with random noise in the data. However, the tool is also able to call CNVs from BAF values alone in case your input does not feature LRR information.
param.option: Yes (requires input with both BAF and LRR subfields)

param.name: BAF_weight
param.label: Baf Weight
param.help: relative contribution from BAF

param.name: BAF_dev_query
param.label: Query sample BAF deviation
param.help: Expected BAF deviation in the query sample (default: 0.04)

param.name: BAF_dev_control
param.label: Control sample BAF deviation
param.help: Expected BAF deviation in the control sample (default: 0.04)

param.name: LRR_weight
param.label: LRR Weight
param.help: Relative contribution from LRR. This option can have a big effect on the number of calls produced. With truly random noise (such as in simulated data), the value should be set high (1.0), but in the presence of systematic noise when LRR values are not informative, lower values result in cleaner calls (default: 0.2).

param.name: LRR_dev_query
param.label: Query sample LRR Deviation
param.help: Expected LRR deviation in the query sample (default: 0.2)

param.name: LRR_dev_control
param.label: Control sample LRR Deviation
param.help: Expected LRR deviation in the control sample (default: 0.2)

param.name: LRR_smooth_win
param.label: LRR Smoothing Window
param.help: Window of LRR moving average smoothing (default: 10)

param.name: BAF_dev_query
param.label: Query sample BAF deviation
param.help: Expected BAF deviation in the query sample (default: 0.04)

param.name: BAF_dev_control
param.label: Control sample BAF deviation
param.help: Expected BAF deviation in the control sample (default: 0.04)

param.name: err_prob
param.label: Err Prob
param.help: Uniform error probability

param.name: same_prob
param.label: Same Prob
param.help: The prior probability of the query and the control sample being the same. Setting to 0 calls both independently, setting to 1 forces the same copy number state in both. (default: 0.5)

param.name: xy_prob
param.label: Xy Prob
param.help: The HMM probability of transition to another copy number state. Increasing this value leads to smaller and more frequent calls.
